intro: Haplopetalon, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, with narrow, linear leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Haplopetalon is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
